SENT.plain: BehÃ§et's disease (BD) is a chronic multisystem inflammatory disorder characterized by recurrent oral and genital ulcers, skin eruptions and uveitis
Neurological, gastrointestinal, and musculoskeletal systems are also involved
Although venous and arterial vasculitis occur in up to one-third of patients, intracardiac thrombus is a very rare complication
We herein report the case of a 46-year-old man with BD who presented with a large right atrial thrombus
Within a month after surgical removal, the thrombus recurred and was successfully treated with immunosuppressants that included prednisolone and cyclophosphamide
